summary: This is an email chain from January 2019 between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing Jeffrey Epstein's travel records obtained from U.S. Customs and Border Protection. It details his extensive private flight history from 2016-2018, primarily between Teterboro, NJ, and Paris, France, with trips to the U.S. Virgin Islands, and clarifies how CBP records certain domestic flights within U.S. territories.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject whose international and domestic travel records from October 2016 onward are being analyzed by the U.S. Attorney's Office. The document lists his private flights, including tail numbers of his aircraft.

events.title: Start of Travel Record Review
events.description: The date from which Jeffrey Epstein's travel records were provided by CBP to the U.S. Attorney's Office for review.

events.title: Outbound Flight to Paris
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled outbound from Teterboro, NJ (KTEB) to Le Bourget, Paris (LFPB).

events.title: Flight from USVI to St. Barts
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled outbound from Cyril E. King Airport, USVI (TIST) to St. Barts (TFFJ).

events.title: Final Recorded Inbound Flight
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's last recorded inbound flight in the provided data, from Le Bourget, Paris (LFPB) to Teterboro, NJ (KTEB).

locations: Cyril E. King Airport, U.S. Virgin Islands (TIST)
Long Island MacArthur Airport, Islip, NY (KISP)
keyFacts: The document is a law enforcement email analyzing Jeffrey Epstein's travel from October 2016 to November 2018, showing frequent private flights between New Jersey/New York and Paris.

It notes potential missed recordings for back-to-back outbound flights on specific dates (e.g., Feb 16-17, 2017) and clarifies that 'vehicle' entries from the USVI are domestic, not international, crossings.
The analysis raises the point that if Epstein traveled from the USVI to foreign territories like the British Virgin Islands, he would have had to report to CBP as a registered sex offender.
Five private aircraft tail numbers are associated with Epstein's travel: N212JE, N120JE, N415LM, N331JE, and N90JE.
The correspondence is marked as Law Enforcement Sensitive and outlines procedures for authenticating the records for court use, as the sender is not authorized to testify as a CBP custodian.
